item.title: Can we use slice as Map Keys in Go
item.description: Question: Can we use slice as map key in Go? Short answer is No Do you want to know more? Okay, Let’s have a look at spec. From Map spec: The comparison operators == and != must be fully defined for operands of the key type; thus the key type must not be a function, map, or slice. Map spec already tells us that slice can’t be a key, but we can also check it in the comparison spec:
